column4: Would it be correct to describe Ubuntu as an "out of the box" desktop version of Debian? Isn't it the equivalent of let's say Mandrake but with the stability and structure of Debian?
its basically Sid with bug fixes and xorg...
actually... Sid doesn't have Gnome 2.10 yet either..
Do you think the i696 optimized debs will grow? Do you know if this is a goal of Ubuntu?
or the 'update-notification' and 'update-manager'  packages
icewm here heh
right now... its just libc-686 that is providing binary optimizations
sure... they are provided just like in Debian... via deb-src listings in sources.list
it was ages ago I tried debian so I did not recall
Ubuntu has a better packaging policy... any joe shmoe can build a package and upload for arch... often things are broken
not even related to what I meant, but ok
there are actually steps involved in being certified to maintain a package in Debian... for arch, nothing...
its umm... nude people
I've heard it's called PORN
nah... its like artistic and stuff... they go out of there way to ensure it doesn't turn any one on   :(
umm.. yeah... All the movies and pics containing "nude people" I watch is umm...artistic and tasty. *crosses fingers*
good luck  :)
that was quick
yes
will glad to have ya  :)
